data.name: Stellar Stout
data.description: This ale’s attributes can first be seen in the beautiful opaque, black color and creamy tan head. A gentle swirl of this ale reveals to the nose a subtle fruitiness layered with cocoa and roasted aromas. The flavor is slightly sweet balanced perfectly by its midrange alcohol level and overall drinkability, making this stout truly stellar!

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: No-Li Brewhouse
breweries.description:
If Spokane were a liquid it would most certainly be our beer. Born & Raised in Washington’s Inland Empire, we’re an internationally award-winning brewery, crafting Spokane-Style beers with No Boundaries: innovative beers made in Spokane, by Spokane residents, using ingredients sourced from within 300 miles of Spokane. We create beers that push ourselves & No-Li drinkers beyond the boundaries… taking a leap beyond the typical beer-drinking experience, and into a memorable adventure. No Boundaries, No-Li!

The pub features Inland Northwest-style pub food, with an emphasis on "keeping it local." Most of the dishes are created from scratch, and use as many locally sourced ingredients as possible. 

For more information about our beers, brewery & the pub, visit www.nolibrewhouse.com.

data.name: Sternwheeler Stout
data.description: This dark almost black beergets its deep rich mocha taste from roasted barley, chocolate and black patent malts combined with Northwest two-row barley. If you like stouts you'll love this one. If you don't like stouts this one could change your mind.

data.name: Sticky Fat
data.description: Early Fall has farmers picking whole cone hops and shipping them to us to brew a wet hop beer. We kick up a black beer with a very sticky character. Beware of the StickyFat Bear.

breweries.name: Half Acre Beer Company
breweries.description:
Half Acre Beer Co. is a brewing company in the Northcenter neighborhood of Chicago, IL. We built a brewery in the middle of the city where we brew small batch beers, and have a store & tasting area where we sample our beers and sell them to go in all package styles. 

We make different beers throughout the year, some we brew all the time and some are only around for a very short period. Our focus is to expand our abilities and enjoy our work.

breweries.name: Brewery Terra Firma
breweries.description:
Brewery Terra Firma is unique in its approach as a brewery and as an agricultural destination. Through the integration of sustainable production methods, environmentally conscious waste management and innovative water recycling/reclamation techniques, we hope to become a model for breweries and agricultural destinations throughout the nation.

The BrewhouseThe brew house is an engineered mix of new and old technologies and techniques. Whole ingredients are used with traditional brewing equipment which is controlled by state of the art systems that manage temperature throughout the brewing process. These same systems harvest waste BTU's, capturing the energy that would normally be lost and reusing it to preheat ingredients, maintain product temperatures, and even heat the taproom via an in-floor heating system. Waste materials such as process water and spent grain are also captured and stored for fertilization and irrigation of our crops.

The prep table in the brewery quite often looks like the prep area in a fine restaurant. Fresh herbs, fruits and vegetables are a common sight, along with an amazing array of spices, roots and even flowers. Whole foods, fresh frozen or dried are used, artificial flavorings, extracts and coloring agents are not. The beer is unfiltered, its clarity being attained by the addition of natural clarifying agents and allowing ample time for the beer to condition.

Brewery Terra Firma began brewing operations in May of 2013, with the taproom opening to the public in July of the same year.

breweries.name: Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.description:
Our brewers eat, drink and sleep beer. They’re equal parts scientist, artist and beer geek. So, while every Rock Bottom brewer is passionate about their craft, they also put their own signature into every beer.

In other words, there is a unique beer menu at every Rock Bottom in addition to our core line up of consistent flavor profiles that you can expect at any Rock Bottom you visit nationwide.

But, you’re thirsty and want to know what beers you can expect down here, right?

data.name: Stone Cellar Stout
data.description: This is a traditional oatmeal stout. Expect this, our darkest beer, to have a pleasant, full flavor and a smooth profile that may include coffee, chocolate and caramel notes. Bitterness is moderate and rounds out beautifully in the finish.

breweries.name: Stone Cellar Brewpub & Restaurant
breweries.description:
1989 was the year this particular brewery was established. At the time, it was Wisconsin’s third Brewpub. Since that time #1 and #2 have vanished leaving Stone Cellar Brewpub the oldest, continually running Brewpub in the state of Wisconsin. All this in a building built 151 years ago to house a brewery!

We brew in 7 barrel (217 gallon) batches on an old, yet reliable brewhouse and can produce up to 1,000 barrels per year. We also have a small bottling line which allows us to sell bottles of our beers right from our bar.

Stone Cellar beer to go!
6 packs and growlers of Stone Cellar beer can be purchased in our bar area to enjoy at home!

breweries.name: Chattanooga Brewing Company
breweries.description: Chattanooga Brewing Company opened in 1890 and lasted until 1915 and was the choice of beer drinkers in Chattanooga, selling beer in most of the local taverns and in cases of bottles. Among their brands of the day were Imperial Pilsner and Magnolia. Returning to the local beer scene in 2010, they have brought back Imperial Pilsner and many other tasty brews. Many German, English, and American styles are featured throughout the year.

Beers brewed at Marzoni's are dispensed directly from our chilled serving tanks to the tap stations on the bar for the freshest beer around! On any given day, there are at least 8 beers on tap, not to mention house-brewed root beer. Brewery tours are available!

breweries.name: Triple Rock Brewery and Alehouse
breweries.description:
Even as one of the oldest brewpubs in the country, Triple Rock is all about keeping things fresh. Fresh craft beer served along fresh food, with menus and specials changing and updating all the time. On any two consecutive days here you will likely find something new and different to try, or you’re welcome to stick with your favorites (those will be fresh too). 

That’s one of the advantages of Triple Rock, where you can watch our brewers make the beer and know that you’ll be drinking it as soon as its done—no kegging, no bottling necessary, just straight from the tanks to your glass. Also, with 11 serving tanks and 8 fermenters on the premises, we can always keep something fresh on our beer board. Do you feel yourself getting thirsty?

breweries.name: Bull & Bush Pub & Brewery
breweries.description:
In 1971, casting aside their stockbroker careers to become the bellwether personalities of the Denver restaurant industry in the 70s and 80s, the brothers built the Bull & Bush to kick start a list of successful restaurants.

Last but certainly not least, the pub is now also a brewery. Since brewing its first batch on New Year’s Day of 1997, the Bull & Bush brewing operation has become world renowned for its great tasting and innovative creations. Master Brewer Gabe Moline’s brews have earned multiple accolades including the Best Beer in a Brewpub award in Westword‘s Best of Denver, multiple awards at the annual Denver-hosted Great American Beer Festival (GABF) and most recently the Bull and Bush’s “The Legend of the Liquid Brain Imperial Stout” was given the highest honor, a Gold award, at the World Beer Cup – the world’s largest commercial beer competition.

data.name: Stonewall Stout
data.description: We use roasted and flaked barley malt to produce a dry stout that pours pitch black and opaque with an aroma that is subtle, sweet, and pleasantly malty with strong coffee notes, and hints of dark chocolate. The rich flavor is a nice balance of sweet, roasty and bitterness. The body is medium-light and Stonewall Stout stands firm with full flavor. So good you’ll say, “I’d give my right arm for a Stonewall Stout!”

breweries.name: Blue and Gray Brewing Co
breweries.description: The Blue & Gray Brewing Co. opened in Fredericksburg on March 17, 2002.  Before that, Fred Red Ale and the Blue & Gray Classic Lager were brewed at other  microbreweries in Virginia. We listened to customer input and perfected our recipes  before we started brewing in Fredericksburg. Blue & Gray Brewing Co. now offers Falmouth American  Pale Ale and Stonewall Stout for a total of four flavors year round. We also offer Spiced  Winter Ale for Thanksgiving through January, Chocolate Raspberry Stout for January-February and  Virginia Hefeweizen Memorial Day through Labor Day.

breweries.name: San Fernando Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Family-owned craft microbrewery in the city of San Fernando. Tap room open Thursday-Saturday 12-10, Sunday 12-7.

data.name: Stony Man Stout
data.description:
Silver Medal 1998 World Beer Championships. Gold Medal, 1998 National Brew-on-Premises Competition. Stony Man is brewed using traditional English techniques for stouts with oatmeal for smoothness and creaminess. The result is an easy-drinking stout that is a little less bitter than most stouts. Stony Man is a famous landmark along Skyline Drive in Shenandoah National Park.

Stony Man is popular with anyone who enjoys stouts. Because of its smoothness, it is also a good choice for introducing people to stouts and dark beers in general. The alcohol content by volume is 6 percent.

If you like Stony Man Stout, check out what they say about the Oak Barrel Conditioned version (also a Silver Medal Winner)!

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Shenandoah Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The brewery consists of several areas within a total floor space of 5600 square feet. The areas on the main floor include the pub, brew house, bottling area, fermentation and conditioning rooms, and the warehouse. The pub, brew house and bottling areas are open to the public. There is a mezzanine level on which our business office, lab, and grain mill are located. The mezzanine level also contains a customer seating area.

The pub is located in the front of the brewery. There is seating for 7 at the bar, 22 at the tables on the main floor and 20 at tables on the mezzanine. The brewery, BOP (the acronym for brew-on-premises), and pub are open the same hours, so beer and food is always available during our open hours and while you are brewing.

style.name: American-Style Stout

Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Coronado Brewing Company
breweries.description:
When we opened the doors to our beach town brew pub on Coronado Island in
1996, we wanted it to be the kind of place where friends count enjoy great
beer, a good meal and a laid-back atmosphere.
Now, years later, our brewery’s a lot bigger and we’ve gotten a number of
awards. But we’re still following that same dream: brewing exceptionallly
balanced beer that’s authentically inspired by our West Coast roots. And
offering that experience to an ever-growing family that seeks an undeniable
coastal vibe, and shares our passion for great beer.
Welcome to Coronado Brewing Company. A Coastal Calling.

Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: double nickel brewery
breweries.description:
WE’RE NOT YOUR AVERAGE STARTUP BREWERY.
We don’t have a storybook tale about leaving boring desk jobs to turn a homebrewing hobby into a business. The truth is, we never did the desk job thing.

Head Brewer and Co-Founder Drew Perry has been brewing beer his whole professional life, working his way from the packaging line to head brewer. At his most recent gig, Drew lead recipe development and contract brewing for a Virginia-based operation that produced beer for dozens of other microbreweries. But the dream was always the same: to return to New Jersey and start his own brewery, using his own recipes and sharing the experience with friends and family.

Several months ago, that dream became a reality. And that’s the story of Double Nickel—or at least the beginning.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Lantern Brewing
breweries.description:
Lantern Brewing is a very, very small brewery in the Greenwood-Phinney neighborhood of Seattle, Washington State, USA.

Our passion is beer, its enjoyment with food, and the history and culture that goes with it.

Our goal is to create beer that will enlighten the drinker; it will refresh and nourish, it will complement your food and bring to light new flavors, it will enliven the ambience and provide a delicious and memorable experience with each passing sip...

We will focus on highest-quality ingredients, sourced as locally as possible.  We will nurture the beer carefully through the brewing process, allowing it to change, mature, and to come into its prime; once it's ready, we'll make sure it finds its way to you!

style.name: American-Style Stout

Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Bellows Brew Crew
breweries.description: Bellows moved from Waunakee to Watertown in December 2001. Their new location sports a ten-barrel brewhouse in the front window, and a pool table in the back. I'm told their building will allow them to triple their ground-level floor space, and there's also a huge banquet-type room on the second floor, and a ballroom on the third, so watch for some major expansion here in the future.

data.name: Stout
data.description: Rich, dark beer.  Taste of coffee and chocolate from 4 varieties of malt, 2-row brewers malt, English Chocolate, black malt and roasted barley.  Great hop flavor and aroma from Liberty and East Kent Goldings Hops.  Smooth, what a Stout should be.

breweries.name: Von Jakob Brewery
breweries.description:
As Von Jakob Vineyard, we have brought exceptional wines to the Southern Illinois area and beyond for over 15 years. Now, we are excited to introduce Von Jakob Brewery, complete with hand-crafted brews, made exclusively at our Orchard location in Alto Pass, Illinois.

Offering eight styles of beer ranging from our crisp, clean, lightly-hopped American Pilsner to our rich, dark Stout, you are sure to find a beer that delights your palate. Or, if you are having trouble choosing just one, we offer a flight of all eight delicious beers. We also have a great selection of domestic beers as well as premium beers from around the world for your enjoyment.

And for our wine enthusiasts out there, do not worry – our winery isn’t going anywhere. We just thought we would offer you a different libation of choice, should you want to explore it.

We sincerely thank you for your support over the years, and we welcome you to come and experience this next adventure with us!

breweries.name: Blue Star Brewing Company
breweries.description: Owned and operated by Joey and Maggie Villarreal of Joey's on N. St. Mary's Street, the BSBC has been open since June 25, 1996. We offer medal-winning beers, an exceptional wine list, and delicious food. The brew pub is located in the Blue Star Arts Complex at 1414 S. Alamo, on the San Antonio river across the street from the Pioneer flour mill. The stainless steel vats and brewing facility are right at home in what was once an old beer storage warehouse. Friendly staff and warm wood decor make for a comfortable, casual atmosphere.

data.name: Stout
data.description: Velvety black and perfectly opaque, this surprisingly smooth, drinkable beer is a delightful harmony of roasted and malted barleys.  Flavors of cocoa and coffee abound in this limited production brew.

breweries.name: Burwood Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Burwood Brewing Company is a local craft brewery in the heart of the Walla Walla wine region. The owners, David and Jennifer Marshall, bring with them a wealth of experience and knowledge regarding the operation of a brewery. David is a veteran brewer with 10 years of experience in professional brewing and Jennifer has 4 years of experience in office administration and marketing for a brewery. They have a passion to bring high quality craft beers to Walla Walla, WA.

David and Jennifer’s goals are simple; produce great beer for the region in which they live and love so much as well as to offer a cozy and friendly space where their creations can be experienced and enjoyed.

data.name: Stout
data.description:
Is there a more appropriately named beer style than stout? Dark, robust, opaquely possessive of heady aromas and rich fulfilling flavor, its name defines its assets. Ours is brewed with layers of roasted barley and black malts, and just enough flavor hops for a balanced smooth finish. By any definition, a superior beer.
Also available aged in bourbon barrels.

breweries.name: Foothills Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Foothills Brewing began in 2004 in Winston-Salem, NC, and has evolved into one of the top craft brewing operations in the southeast United States. Ranked among ratebeer.com’s 100 best breweries in the world, Foothills has garnered numerous awards for their beers, including seven Great American Beer Festival medals and three World Cup Beer medals, more than any other North Carolina-based brewery.

Foothills brews more than twenty year-round and seasonal offerings, including best sellers Hoppyum IPA and Carolina Blonde. Year-round brands also include People’s Porter, Torch Pilsner and Jade IPA; seasonals include Cottonwood Pumpkin and the highly anticipated Sexual Chocolate Imperial Stout. Foothills, Cottonwood and Carolina brands are distributed by a network of top-level distributors in North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia, and Washington D.C.

data.description: Do you like coffee?  How about chocolate? Cream?  This beer tastes like all of them at the same time, with a balanced finishe of hop and roast.  This is my best homebrew recipe for an American Stout.  Enjoy the dark!

breweries.name: Ohio Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Ohio Brewing Company is an award-winning microbrewery located in downtown Akron in the historic Selle building. Our brewery produces a wide array of styles, form German ales to Irish Red ales to Stouts and even Oktoberfest lagers.

The original Ohio Brewing Company was founded in 1997 in Niles, Ohio by current owner Chris Verich. Our current operation is a new venture by Chris in Akron, Ohio to produce these award-winning beers in a craft production brewery setting.

breweries.name: Aslan Brewing Company
breweries.description: Aslan Brewing Company is a local microbrewery committed to pushing the boundaries of craft beer while preserving the purity of brewing tradition. We only use the finest certified organic ingredients the Pacific Northwest has to offer, creating some of the cleanest and most unique brews in the market today. Truly dank brew; Pride of the Organic Northwest.

data.name: Stout
data.description:
The very first beer we brewed at Little Toad Creek was an Oatmeal Stout. We use Biscuit malt to give a roasty 
malt flavor that works well with the oats. Only slightly sweet, this Stout gets it just right!

breweries.name: Little Toad Creek Brewery
breweries.description:
Little Toad Creek Brewery & Distillery is a craft producer of beer and spirits. The Brewery currently produces Amber Ale, Stout, Porter, and IPA. The Distillery produces vodka, silver rum, & spiced rum, green chile vodka, and whiskey (in limited quantities!)

Our new tasting room has just opened in downtown Silver City serving craft beer, spirits, and fine pub food.

data.name: Stout
data.description: Creamy, malty, and full-bodied, the Stout is satisfyingly rich. Caramel and black malts give the Stout its deep, dark color and pronounced roasted flavor, balanced by a smooth hop flavor.

data.description: Burnside Stout is brewed with imported Simpson malts and East Kent Golding hops. Our Stout features bold notes of coffee and chocolate, with a dry roasty finish. Notice the beautiful thick brown head and deep opaque color. Pair it equally well with a main course of meat, or a dessert of chocolate.

breweries.name: Eddyline Restaurant and Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Eddyline Brewery has been brewing in the heart of Collegiate Peaks in Buena Vista, Colorado since 2009.

All beer are brewed with inspiration from our wild surroundings. Crank Yanker IPA is the best beer for cruising single track all over the valley. River Runners Pale Ale is the greatest all day suds sipper on the river and beyond. Come visit and have a great time in the Colorado Wilderness!

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Raquette River Brewing
breweries.description: Racquette River Brewing is 2 bbl production brewery located in Tupper Lake, NY. We brew small batch, hand crafted Adirondack Ales.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Fridays 4 to 7
Saturdays 11 to 5

data.name: Stout
data.description: Most everyone has heard of this style, even if they haven’t tried it.  Our version is a traditional dry Stout, found in the southern part of Ireland.  It’s dark, drinkable and definitely true to style.

breweries.name: Square One Brewery & Distillery
breweries.description: The Square One Brewery & Distillery began operations as a brewery /restaurant in February of 2006. In August of 2008 Square One became the first microdistillery restaurant in the state of Missouri and one of the first in the country. We believe that our approach to the alcohol beverage program is unique and very different from that of other restaurants. We believe in crafting the products we serve whether it is spirits, beer or food. By combining the expertise of our distiller, our master brewer, and our chef we are committed to creating an amazing array of flavors and tastes for our customers.

locations.name: Main Brewery

Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:30 am
